piffle","reviewBody":"Cluttered, sloppy romantic comedy would have benefited from the elimination of a few of its many stories. Mixed bag of performances, both Julia and Emma Roberts, Cooper, Dane are charismatic and do what they can to flesh out thin characters. Anne Hathaway and Topher Grace have a great chemistry and really could have supported their own independent romantic comedy. MacLaine and Elizondo are wasted in a throwaway story that does contain a nice twist. Several of the quality performers, like Queen Latifah and Kathy Bates are shoved in small parts strictly for marquee value. Most of the others range from adequate to vapid. Taylor Swift stands out for giving the most annoying performance. Let's hope that this is the beginning and the end of her acting career. One last thought, with all the talent available they chose to focus the largest portion of the film's story on someone as bland as Kutcher? Bad idea.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":115351,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

towel","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0817230/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jjnxn-1","dateCreated":"2013-05-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Overstuffed piffle","reviewBody":"Cluttered, sloppy romantic comedy would have benefited from the elimination of a few of its many stories. Mixed bag of performances, both Julia and Emma Roberts, Cooper, Dane are charismatic and do what they can to flesh out thin characters. Anne Hathaway and Topher Grace have a great chemistry and really could have supported their own independent romantic comedy. MacLaine and Elizondo are wasted in a throwaway story that does contain a nice twist. Several of the quality performers, like Queen Latifah and Kathy Bates are shoved in small parts strictly for marquee value. Most of the others range from adequate to vapid. Taylor Swift stands out for giving the most annoying performance. Let's hope that this is the beginning and the end of her acting career. One last thought, with all the talent available they chose to focus the largest portion of the film's story on someone as bland as Kutcher? Bad idea.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":115351,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"duration":"PT2H5M"</script><metacontent="

This is more of a guy comedy type movie but my gf loved it also.

The donuts scene I must say was a little gross but still the movie was amazing. Laughed from start to finish..... This is the kind of guy everyone would like to be or know in College.

programme.title: The Wedding Ringer
Die Trauzeugen AG
programme.desc:
The Wedding Ringer: Directed by Jeremy Garelick. With Kevin Hart, Josh Gad, Affion Crockett, Kaley Cuoco. Two weeks shy of his wedding, a socially awkward guy enters into a charade by hiring the owner of a company that provides best men for grooms in need." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0884732/","name":"The Wedding Ringer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk3MjQyNTUxNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjM3Mjk1MzE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0366389/","name":"Kevin Hart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1265802/","name":"Josh Gad"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192505/","name":"Kaley Cuoco"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1275670/","name":"Jeremy Garelick"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0479739/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010568/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1275670/","name":"Jeremy Garelick"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1191891/","name":"Jay Lavender"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1738387225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxNTgwNjkzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjAxNzk3MjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxNTgwNjkzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjAxNzk3MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Doug Harris is a lovable but socially awkward groom-to-be with a problem: he has no best man. With less than two weeks to go until he marries the woman of his dreams, Doug is referred to Jimmy Callahan, owner and CEO of Best Man, Inc., a company that provides flattering best men for socially challenged guys in need."},"datePublished":"2015-01-16","description":"Two weeks shy of his wedding, a socially awkward guy enters into a charade by hiring the owner of a company that provides best men for grooms in need.","keywords":"bachelor party,bride and groom,marriage,nipples visible through clothing,bare breasts","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0884732/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lnvicta"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Kevin Hart's best performance and sporadic laugh-out-loud moments, but it ultimately clutches onto the same tropes and beats as other movies of its ilk.","reviewBody":"I really wanted to like this movie, mainly because I think Kevin Hart has had a rough few years. Not financially of course; the guy has been starring in more than a few comedies the past couple years, but critically, none of them (Ride Along, Get Hard, About Last Night) can be called a genuinely great movie. The Wedding Ringer is the best of the bunch, though. This is Kevin Hart in his element - his most dynamic performance and playing a Hitch-style role where he gets hired to be people's best mans for guys who don't have any friends. Josh Gad plays the loser character, and he and Hart have great chemistry and some very funny back and forth moments. I was actually surprised at how much I was enjoying this movie for the first half, but then the problems became too glaring to ignore.

The premise feels fresh and fun in the beginning. It felt like a cross between Wedding Crashers and I Love You, Man without directly copying either of them. The problem is, those movies had more character depth beyond their two leads. Here, every character besides Hart and Gad are cardboard cutouts. The biggest offender is Paige, played by Kaley Cuoco. She is the most shallow caricature of a woman I've seen in comedy in a long long time. It's a shame because Kaley does what she can, but her character is so one-dimensional you can't even connect with her on any level. The random groomsman have their moments, but they're still only caricatures. There's the buff guy, the fresh out of prison rapist, the guy who likes pulling out his penis, the socially awkward guy, etc. They may have defining traits, but not one of them feels like a fleshed out character.

Structure is another problem in this movie because after an excellent setup, it starts going down the list of the same tropes and beats as every other zany wedding comedy. Competitive family football scene? Check. Guy finding out girl is actually a bitch? Check. Guy and employer who have a strictly business relationship actually become friends in the end? Check. It's a shame because when Kevin Hart is given a chance to shine, he shines. But those moments become less and less often as the movie tries to tie itself neatly with a bow in the third act.

The Wedding Ringer is good for a few laughs, but in the end it's just another Kevin Hart comedy that had potential but didn't explore it. The man has proved himself to be a comedic force to be reckoned with. Now it's just a waiting game until he finds a script that fully plays to his strengths. Until then, The Wedding Ringer seems to be the one to beat, and as far as raunchy comedies go, you could do a lot worse.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":72020,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

30 second spot"},"datePublished":"2008-06-06","description":"An Israeli Special Forces Soldier fakes his death so he can re-emerge in New York City as a hair stylist.","keywords":"hair stylist,palestinian,funny arab,arab israeli conflict,super strength","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0960144/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tomlin-96710"},"dateCreated":"2015-06-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Comedy Gold!!!!","reviewBody":"This movie makes me laugh every single time I watch it. I am very much into the "Slapstick" type of comedy and this movie fits it like a glove. I Have always loved Adam Sandler movies because you always know you will be entertained. I can honestly say that there wasn't a point where I was watching this movie when I didn't laugh. If you love comedy WATCH THIS MOVIE you will not be disappointed. I really don't get why this movie has such a low rating. if you are looking for movies with deeper meanings and mind-blowing plots then by all means find a different movie.

BUT....

If you want to sit back, relax and laugh until you physically cant anymore then you've found your movie. Enjoy ;)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":193217,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Anger Management: Directed by Peter Segal. With Adam Sandler, Jack Nicholson, Marisa Tomei, Luis Guzmán. Dave Buznik is a businessman who is wrongly sentenced to an anger management program, where he meets an aggressive instructor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0305224/","name":"Anger Management","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDg1YTNiODItZGYyOC00NGIwLWI3MjYtMTY3NDQ0ZDIwYjBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000197/","name":"Jack Nicholson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001191/","name":"Adam Sandler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000673/","name":"Marisa Tomei"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0781842/","name":"Peter Segal"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0153052/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0233563/","name":"David Dorfman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Anger Management","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi945792025","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjQ1NmFjMTMtZWViOC00ZDlhLWI0YTYtY2MwZGVlMDQwMTQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjQ1NmFjMTMtZWViOC00ZDlhLWI0YTYtY2MwZGVlMDQwMTQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Anger Management"},"datePublished":"2003-06-18","description":"Dave Buznik is a businessman who is wrongly sentenced to an anger management program, where he meets an aggressive instructor.","keywords":"psychologist,lesbian,lesbian kiss,anger,airplane","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0305224/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mick987g"},"dateCreated":"2003-05-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Check your Anger on the way out","reviewBody":"Let me start off by saying that I am not a big Adam Sandler fan. But this movie was hilarious. Nicholson and Sandler work very well together.

John Turturro as usual plays his part well as Chuck.

Marisa Tomei part is good but as a Tomei fan it is not enough

How every Jack Nicholson is his usual psycho funny self in this movie. Pushing the envelope so far with Sandlers character Dave Buznik.

1 hour and 41 minutes passed like the wind.

And please keep watch Woody Harrelson like you have never seen him before. Try not to give too much away here with that one. But somewhere in this movie you will see what I mean

Hope you enjoy the movie as much as I did"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":205770,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="
